duties_responsibilities.duty: Research and develop case information, evidence, and settlement options.
Track cases and handle trial preparations with senior attorney.
Work with paralegals/legal assistants to execute case strategy and manage high level/high asset cases.

Keep cases on track with organized files; monitoring calendars; meeting deadlines; documenting actions; researching case law; inputting information into file database and case management software; confirming case status with support staff and communicating regularly with clients.
Examine legal data to determine advisability of defending lawsuit.
Document actions by completing forms, reports, logs, and records.

Communicate regularly with clients and maintain contact with people involved in the case; preparing for depositions; reviewing standard court documents; drafting letters; writing and reviewing discovery; dictating responses to opposing counsel; generating status reports.
Keep clients informed by maintaining contact; communicating case progress.
Prepare case summaries and materials for mediation conferences; preparing pleadings; monitoring discovery responses; organizing materials for team case review.
Organize evidence; preparing exhibits; scheduling witnesses; ensuring that witnesses are ready/prepared when needed.

education_certification.credential: Juris Doctor (J.D.) degree from an accredited law school
